utterance.speaker: Originally aired
utterance.content: Sept 26 2006

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Follow my finger. Adam, show me a bicycle. Eyes here. Adam? Show me a bicycle.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: No buddy, that's a ball. Adam look at me, are you hungry? Show me what you want for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Still drawing those lines instead of looking at the cards.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: More juice?

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He wants more juice he has to ask for it. Adam? Buddy? Eyes here.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: He's tired Dom.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Wouldn't be if we stuck to the schedule. Show me the juice, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Think we've reached the point of diminished returns.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He has to ask for it. Adam!

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: He's choking!

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: That's impossible, it's mac and cheese.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 10-yr-old boy screams for his life for no reason.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's autistic, severely autistic. Can't talk, can't make eye contact. Screaming's probably his way of communicating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And he went to 3 different doctors who all said just that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wow, so clearly that can't be the answer. His brain can't filter information, it's a constant assault on his senses I'd scream too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or it's something medical sounding like dysesthesia. Parents are convinced that there's something wrong with their son.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Since when do we start believing parents? Or anyone? Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Elevator. Dad was on Wall Street, mom was a partner in an accounting firm, when their son was diagnosed with autism they both quit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So they're overprotective and scared, that's all the more reason to--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They've studied this kid, heard him scream a million times. Did 10 years of caring for him, this is the first time they've brought him to a hospital.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ER checked his throat, no obstructions, nothing! Which means the only symptom was a scream, which is diagnostic of nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kid clutched his chest, BP was elevated; maybe there was chest pain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ER said the heart was fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't be so quick to dismiss pain.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Down. Stool sample to check for parasites, blood culture to rule out infection and ANA for lupus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because he screamed?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could also be an environmental reaction; an allergy, dust, wheat, pollen, a toxin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check the house. Run a lung ventilation scan. Lungs are in the chest too, right?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I had a date last night, she screamed. Should we spend a 100,000 dollars testing her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course not, this isn't a veterinary hospital. Zing! Look, if you don't think this kid is worth saving--

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's not what I'm saying!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well that's too bad, it's a good point. Kid's just a lump with tonsils. You know what it's going to be like trying to put an autistic kid into a nuclear scanner? I don't envy you guys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want my old carpet back.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Err; we're going to have to do this later. A kid in the clinic had an accident. Generally when people are on the phone--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want my old carpet back.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It was stained, with blood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, my blood. Which makes the carpet part of me, I want it back. I want to be buried with it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You think you can get me to do anything you want regardless of how stupid it is?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's identical to the old carpet, except without the hazardous biological waste.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I shall not return to my office until every patented durable microfibre has been restored to its rightful place.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Inspiring. If you don't want to work in your office, work in the clinic. You don't want to work in the clinic, go home and don't get paid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Attica! Attica! Attica! Attica! Attica! Attica?

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He just needs to finish this level.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We only have the scanner for the next half hour, after that--

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Trust me; you don't want to move him until he's finished.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The sooner we do this test, the sooner we can get you guys home.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Adam? Do you think that--

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: 10 minutes tops.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If he has a vascular disorder, we might not have--

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He might not have 10 minutes?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't have 10 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: No! You don't want to do that! Adam! Adam!

utterance.speaker: Patient 1
utterance.content: I used Metamucil like the doctor told me and finally I was able to use the bathroom but I saw something in the toilet I couldn't identify. I wrapped it in tissue paper so you could take a look.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Can't you sedate him or something?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could if I didn't want the test results to mean anything.

utterance.speaker: Patient 2
utterance.content: Painkillers, exercises, I even did that puncture thing, nothing works. Then this morning, I get up, my back feels great. I figured I'd better get down here right away.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Big shocker, dad's depressed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Save your time, SSRIs don't cause chest pain. Wow. Every minute of every day is booked. He eats, sleeps, plays his handheld.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not much of a life for them.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They chose to have a family; you don't get to decide what your kid's going to be like.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nobody chooses this.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's funny. You get a normal kid, a parent works. You get a special kid that costs more; you quit and turn the backyard into a therapy circuit.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yes, if only you were handicapped, all the good times you could have had with dad.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Hey doctor House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hello girl whose name I don't remember but whose dad I treated so I don't really know why she's here.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Ali. Umm... I think I caught what my dad has. The rhino thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. Does that hurt?

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: A little. It's in my chest too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course it is. Kinda had access through the shirt, this'll work.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: That feels good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly when did New Jersey run out of horny 17-yr-old boys?

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: About 5 weeks ago? It's been very lonely.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The ventilation scan was normal, time to send him home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't leave right now. Well congratulations, you are the proud owner of your very own rhino thing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A rhinovirus? You can't leave because she has a cold?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't leave because Cuddy says I can't leave.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: All the tests are normal.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Hey, don't start with me. We're backed up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know this is hard for all of us but thanks to doctor Cuddy I don't have an office so I have to work here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What'd she do to your office?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's unusable. So, whatever's bothering him it wasn't his lungs. What about the kid's house?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There were some pesticides and some alcohol but the tox screen was negative.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which means there's nothing physically wrong with this kid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We already had that discussion. Did we get a fecal smear?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Should we do this some place else?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, Cuddy says I have to work here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, I said you can work in your office or you had to work here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And since I can't work in my office.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is this your master plan? Disrupt hospital business until I replace your carpet?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Devious. Saw it in a James Bond movie. Fecal smear, talk to me!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Get out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Put back my carpet?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No! Get out of here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fecal matter, is there a sample we can look at?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Parents have the smear the kit but the kid is constipated.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Do what you want, not replacing your carpet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go up his rear and get a smear. Which reminds me, I kinda feel like a bagel.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Carpets.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need a stool sample. We should probably wait until he's finished playing that level, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I actually think he's a bit better today. He seems more like his old self.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It is possible that he was never sick.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: I guess we err... could have overreacted.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Adam? Adam!

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Adam!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what makes fluid fill the lining of a kid's lungs?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why are we in here? This is some sort of power play?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. So you stuck your finger in the kid and gave him a pleural effusion. You ever considered getting a manicure?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I took the stool sample after his lungs failed.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Or do you really have a problem with the carpeting? Change sets you off--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said it was a power play, someone answers yes to option A, you don't move on to option B.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If there's a pleural effusion, we have to rule out heart failure.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why now? Why a power play now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I smelled weakness. Get the kid an echocardiogram.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's funny; it says James Wilson, what a strange typo.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The fluid comes back in exudate; get him on broad spectrum antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought you wouldn't mind sharing offices for a while.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You share stories, feelings... toys. You don't share offices.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is so not Zen.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It was a gift, some doctors get those.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you want mornings or afternoons?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You couldn't make Cuddy miserable so you're going to make me miserable so I can make Cuddy miserable on your behalf?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What makes you think I can make her miserable?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you're good at that stuff.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohhh, I'm nothing compared to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is there anything you'll throw out?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's a gift from an 11-yr-old patient of mine, she and I both knew it was a piece of junk and that's what made her laugh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you gotta keep it until she…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She already did.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Adam, I need you to stay still buddy!

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Okay, it's okay, I got him. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: What? What is it? Is his heart ok?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Echo suggested a conduction abnormality, EKG confirmed it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Still doesn't explain the effusion. Pleural fluid was in exudate, we should be looking for something that explains both the heart and lung problems. An infection, parasite, cancer?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Microbiology showed no organisms in the fluid so forget infection.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's not a power play. Doing a differential in the clinic makes sense - piss Cuddy off. Same thing with Wilson's office - works indirectly. But now we're in office space because you don't want to be in your own office which means this has nothing to do with Cuddy, you really are obsessed with your carpets. Which means--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing here? I have this room booked from 2 to 3.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, 2 East coast time? I thought you meant Pacific, which is stupid of me I guess. What about parasites?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stool sample's negative.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's 2 o' clock.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh well, we should go then. That just leaves cancer. Get a lung biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It took a half an hour to get a mask on the kid for the lung scan!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I'm sorry, was there somewhere you needed to be?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, can we talk?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Carpet?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Never.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing to talk about.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your girlfriend called the clinic 15 times looking for you today.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh. A lot to discuss, china patterns--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, she's a stalker.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right, couldn't be that she finds me interesting and attractive. Has to be that she's insane.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's called you 15 times; your mother's not that interested in you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well maybe I'd be better adjusted if she was.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm notifying security.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is this about the carpet? Do you think I'll back off if you block all my fun?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You better not be having fun!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm having fun. I'm not having sex.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's dangerous!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not dangerous.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's pretty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's pretty.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Men are stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm with you so far.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm notifying security.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, give her a break, she's not dangerous, she's... insightful. You can't stop our love!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, you got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We have a 10-yr-old with pleural effusion and conduction abnormality but no heart failure.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Was there a protein in the pleural fluid?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, that's why we're thinking cancer, Non-Hodgkin's probably so we want to do a lung biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Lung biopsies usually come back negative so biopsy a lymph node under the arm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's probably something an Oncologist should do, right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's nothing real tricky to it, just a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Still, just to be safe, you mind?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the love of god, can't somebody shut that kid up? Got people trying to work around here. Why don't you show him a teddy bear or something?

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Somebody you'll never send a gift to.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is doctor House, your son's doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: High test please. Hey, hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Out of vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eating the red berries.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: He trusted you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, that wasn't trust. That was self-preservation.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: No, that was huge. It was like a conversation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Monkey's afraid to eat the red berries until he sees another monkey eat them. Monkey see, monkey do, that's all it was. Your kid's still just as messed up as when we admitted him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That was sensitive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have pretty hair.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hope is all those parents have going for them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, hope is what's making them miserable. What they should do is get a cocker spaniel. A dog would look them in the eye, wag his tail when he's happy, lick their face, show them love.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Is it so wrong for them to want to have a normal child? It's normal to want to be normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spoken like a true circle queen. See skinny socially privileged white people get to draw this neat little circle, and everyone inside the circle is normal, anyone outside the circle should be beaten, broken and reset so they can be brought into the circle. Failing that, they should be institutionalized or worse, pitied.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So it's wrong to feel sorry for this little boy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why would you feel sorry for someone who gets to opt out of the inane courteous formalities which are utterly meaningless, insincere and therefore degrading? This kid doesn't have to pretend to be interested in your back pain or your excretions or your grandma's itchy place. Can you imagine how liberating it would be to live a life free of all the mind-numbing social niceties? I don't pity this kid, I envy him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Err, no cancer... because these aren't lymph cells.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then what are they?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Liver cells.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Liver cells under his arm. I wonder what he's got where his liver's supposed to be.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anyone got a clue how liver cells got into the kid's armpit?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Make yourself at home. So, think maybe Gray's Anatomy got it all wrong?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lymph system circulates fluid, not organ cells.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Cancer cells break into the lymphatic system all the time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But we're not talking about cancer cells.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what's the difference between cancer cells and liver cells, why can one pass through walls but the other can't?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Cancer cells are damaged lets them go into blood vessels, go wherever they want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So if the liver cells are damaged...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Liver isn't damaged. The tests were normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So if the liver cells are damaged -- it's theoretically possible to pass into the lymphatic system. Liver failure could also explain pleural effusion, even the heart issues.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Liver cells are fine, he was immunized for Hep A and B and do you really think this kid is having unprotected sex or sharing needles?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm, daddy does seem the type to use a rubber. So it's not viral. Just leaves a lot of boozerosis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Our 10-yr-old boy does not having a drinking problem or cirrhosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, when we echoed his heart we got a piece of his liver, there was no scarring.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cirrhosis explains the symptoms; heart problems, lungs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Look up cirrhosis in the dictionary, it means scarring.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Parents aren't doing or dosing this kid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How would you know that? Kid can't talk. Why'd you think I took this case? He's not going to give away the ending.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They quit their jobs for him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, they are everything you'd want in a parent. Unfortunately their kid is nothing you'd want. When a baby is born, it's perfect; little fingers, little toes, plump, perfect, pink, and brimming with unbridled potential. Then it's downhill, some hills steeper than others. Parents get off on their kid's accomplishments. Cute! They'll annoy you with trophy rooms and report cards. Hell they'll even show you a purple cow and tell you what a keen eye for color their kid has. But this kid, he doesn't smile, he doesn't hug them, he doesn't laugh. His parents get nothing, the right to brag that their kid picked orange juice out of a line-up.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So you figure they slipped the kid a mickey so they don't have to deal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do a biopsy to confirm cirrhosis and don't try and pawn it off on Wilson, he's going to be busy with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My parents love me unconditionally. Get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't you think the restraining order's a little much? He's not actually going to have sex with a 17-yr-old patient.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't think he was going to ask me to dig a blood-stained carpet out of a dumpster either.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It might be easier in the long run.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are we stopping here so House doesn't find us?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Unless you wanna make out?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You want me to surrender to House's coup?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no, you proactively give him what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I defeat him by surrendering to him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He'll never see it coming. Look, I'll pay for it myself! What is it? A thousand bucks to carpet a room?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Actually it's 400.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohhh!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not doing it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Liver biopsy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They're doing it now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Like a biopsy; needles, cells, screaming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What'd you find in the stool sample?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were too busy bothering Cuddy, as discussed it was negative for parasites. Can we get out of here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't ask what you didn't find; I asked what you did find in the stool sample.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stool. And traces of iron, zinc, calcium carbonate, can we leave?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's the matter? You afraid of the man?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh oh, too late.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Leave my stuff alone!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're meeting with a Guggenheim in 15 minutes wearing that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm going to count to 3 and then, I'm going to fire you. One.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Calcium carbonate, that's uhh... antidiarrheal, right?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Think that's significant? Think hard poops are significant? Two and a half? Never threaten unless you're ready to deliver, makes you look weak. Thank god you don't have children.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Doctor Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take a message.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your patient is being rushed to cardiac ICU.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow, that's like the one thing that would get me out of here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry you can't come in here.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's in v-fib!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Here you go. Charge.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Clear! Charging, clear! Charging, clear!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's stable for the moment, first degree atrioventricular block.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, what else do we know?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His liver's damaged, pleural effusion compromises lung function.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Biopsy was negative for cirrhosis. Parents didn't poison their son.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not his liver, his heart or his lungs. The calcium carbonate in his stool.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's constipated, parents probably just overdid it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or they didn't do it at all. Calcium carbonate's also what's in chalk.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So he ate some chalk, it isn't toxic, sure didn't cause the pleural effusion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget the chalk.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You just said it was about the chalk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, and then I said forget the chalk, you must be very confused. This kid's got pica. Take him to a buffet he's going to eat the table.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Old lead paint?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Level of lead in the blood was normal. His tox screen was clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're not looking for typical poisons we're looking for anything that he can put in his mouth; matches, spiders, bricks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pressure-treated wood used to contain arsenic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even better. Hansel, get samples of the gingerbread house; bag everything.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can get into a lot of trouble being here.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: I wanted to see you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I got that. So did everyone else, they think you're a stalker.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: One could argue those people might be jealous of your attention.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes I actually made that argument.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: You going home?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's the plan.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: In Iceland the age of consent is 14.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm surprised that tourism isn't a bigger industry up there.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: So today I'm jailbait but in 22 weeks anybody can do anything to me. Will I be so different in 22 weeks?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 22 weeks is enough for an embryo to grow arms and legs.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: It's just a line; an arbitrary line drawn by a bunch of sad old men in robes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, who cares what judges think.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Didn't think of you as a guy who followed rules just because they were rules.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are over 10 years younger than me. I said over.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gotta go!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doctor Cuddy, do you happen to know the way to the Icelandic consulate? This young woman, a stranger to me, was just asking directions.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Security was going to call the police; I don't want to do that to you. Go home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She needed a ride.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She got here on her own she can get home on her own. Now! And if I see you on hospital grounds again, I will call the police.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After that look I'm feeling a little frisky, looks like you're up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm ovulating, let's go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The frisky it went away.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, this isn't a game.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I leave her alone can I have my carpet back?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I forget about my carpet can I have her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Jimson weed. Found a small patch of it in his backyard. Jimson weed contains atropine. Poor man's acid. Our kid's been tripping on Lucy in the Sky with Cubic Zirconium; explains the pleural effusion, the heart arrhythmias.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Meeting here will do nothing to upset Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not trying to upset Cuddy; I'm trying to figure out what's wrong with the patient. Continue.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Jimson weed doesn't explain the screaming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've obviously never had a bad trip.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I would have thought you'd try to accomplish two goals at once.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why can't you be more like the other age inappropriate girls who have a thing for me? Just accept me for me. Continue.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Treatment for Jimson weed OD is physostigmine. Kid's got heart issues, the two don't mix. We better make sure that's what he's got.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Serum from the lab in Patterson is 3 days minimum.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He won't survive 3 days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What time does he wake up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then what? Walk me through it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: 7.40 - 7.50 he goes to the toilet, washes his face, what does this matter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm trying to prove he ate the plant.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His schedule has nothing to do with Jimson weed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There are two possibilities, either the parents saw him eat the plant or the kid has unsupervised time and eats plants instead of playing blocks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Even if you find 15 minutes of free time outside doesn't mean he spent it eating a bush.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what do we do? Nothing? Wait for the kid to tell us? What?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To talk to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ever see your son eat a bush?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I haven't.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: I've only ever seen him eat leftover--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Adam! Did you eat something at your house, something that made you sick? I need you to show me what you ate.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He can't answer you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Neither can you. This is your backyard; you may know it as Mel's Diner. Here's your sandbox, your jungle gym, under it is this. I need to know if you ate this, Adam.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: He doesn't know what you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Adam, you have to tell me because if you don't, it'll be game over, you'll be dead.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Show me what you ate. Adam! Show me what you ate.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Adam?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Honey? Adam!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on in, brothers and sister. Welcome to the house of the Lord!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House, come on, the chapel?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We have been blessed with the miracle of a new symptom. Brother can you testify as to why this poor child's eyeball rolled back into his head?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's consistent with Jimson weed poisoning, ocular paralysis. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The wicked shall deceive ye because they have turned from the Lord and are idiots, his ocular muscle didn't paralyze, it pirouetted.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: MS.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is easier for a wise man to gain access to heaven!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can you stop doing that? Just say not MS.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Stroke, bleed in the brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'd be seeing other symptoms besides a single eye misalignment, like a coma, and you've already testified.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a tumor.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And all the imaging just missed it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a micro tumor. Started in his lung which caused the pleural effusion, then it metastasized to his liver which made it slough cells. And then went to his brain behind the eye which caused it to roll back into his head.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So he has 3 tumors and we missed all of them. What's the opposite of a miracle?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I've a better chance of finding it now that I know exactly where to look. So, unless you have a better idea, I'm going to go CT his head and then if I have to, remove his eye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You remove this kid's eye he's only going to be half as good at not making eye contact.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hello? Hello? Hello? I have sad news for you. She doesn't love you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're ugly when you're jealous.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She showed up at my house last night, came on to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's even more perfect than I thought.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House! She's sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You say sick, I say freestyling.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The girl will have sex with an invertebrate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, you're not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She has a problem. You're not doing her any favors by indulging her!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why would you lie like this? Do you not have room in your heart for love?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't believe me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't believe the kids when they said that Suzie was sleeping with Johnny. Didn't believe them then I don't believe them now, I don't care that Suzie married Johnny, he's mine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She has a mole on her right breast just below the nipple.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No she doesn't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You've seen her breasts?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a medical exam. I was listening to her heart; it went "Greg House, Greg House, Greg House".

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Fine, I'm lying. But she did come back, she's locked up in my office, I was hoping you could talk to her, put an end to this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Listen to me; do you have any idea what you'd have to look forward to if you stayed with me? Nine chances out of ten we'd both wind up in a jail.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: You're only saying that to make me go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm saying it 'coz it's true. Inside of us, we both know that you belong with Victor. Is there a Victor in your class? Well if you're not with someone your age, you'll regret it; maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but soon and for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: What about us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'll always have Fresno. I'm no good at being noble but it doesn't take much to see that the problems of two little people don't amount to a hill of beans in this crazy world. Someday you'll understand that. Now, now, here's looking at you-- Damn. Was there an earthquake when you were in Fresno?

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I ask all my girlfriends that.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Umm... yeah a little one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: What? What is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not love, you have spore in your brain; Coccidioides immitis. California's full of them, they get an earthquake they get released into the air, you breathe it in you get a cold, turns into sinus congestion, aches, weakness, milky tears and sometimes loss of inhibition and judgment. Damn!

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: So loving you, wanting to have sex with you is all just the spores talking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'll probably live. Damn!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey! Don't touch his eye!

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: This is an appendectomy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like I said, don't touch his eye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why isn't he in surgery?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Some emergency bumped him; we've got another room in 10 minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better not take him in, kill the lights. He's seeing them all the time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you looking for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's telling us what he's seeing, telling us exactly what was wrong with him, drawing them for us over and over again. Nobody knew how to speak autistic. When I asked him what he ate he even told me that.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: What are you talking about? What was he seeing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hello my pretties. It's not a tumor, Foreman, it's worms swimming in his eye. Animal makes potty in the sandbox, boy plays in the sandbox, boy eats the sand, you can probably tell where this is going by now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stool samples were negative for parasites.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Raccoon roundworms are not excreted by their human host.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cameron tested the sand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All of it? Worms spread from his gut to the rest of his body. Attacked his lungs, that’s what made him scream and caused the effusion. Invade his liver sending dead liver cells coursing through his system, it attacked his eye and the muscles surrounding it making his eyeball do a back flip. Laser photo coagulation can fix the eye and high dose of benzimidazole should kill the worms.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Wait a minute, that's it? He's going to be ok?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good news, he's going to be with you for a long, long time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm going to read you something. "Asperger's syndrome is a mild and rare form of autism. It is typically characterized by difficulty establishing friendships and playing with peers, trouble accepting conventional social rules, and they dislike any change in setting or routine"... or broadloom. Doesn't say that last part but you get my point.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House doesn't have Asperger's, diagnosis is much simpler; he's a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why do you think he took this case? Because he believes these parents? Because he wants to help a young boy? He sees himself in this kid and he's trying to help himself. He doesn't want this, he needs it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're not autistic; you don't even have Asperger's. You wish you did, it would exempt you from the rules, give you freedom, absolve you of responsibility, let you date 17-yr-olds. But most important it would mean that you're not just a jerk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At what point does a person endlessly lecturing someone make him a jerk? First tongue kiss, an 8 on the happiness scale. Your child being snatched back from the brink of death, that's a 10. They're clocking in at a very tepid 6.5 because they know what they have to go back to.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: Listen... thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: You saved his life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah I know, see ya.

utterance.speaker: Dominic
utterance.content: You're so good!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That was a 10.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: All change is bad? It's not true you know.
